0.content: 一个奇幻的世界,七元素融汇流转。提瓦特是原神的主要舞台和大陆。

1.content: 原神中有七种元素,它们是特殊的状态效果和可以按特定顺序应用来触发元素反应的伤害类型。它们是:风元素、岩元素、雷元素、草元素、水元素、火元素、冰元素。

2.content: 风元素,七元素之一。“风”的名称Anemo来源于与风相关的词汇的前缀“anemo-”,源自古希腊语中“风”的单词。

3.content: 岩元素,是七元素之一。“岩”的名称Geo来源于与地球相关的词汇的前缀“geo-”,源自古希腊语中“地球”的单词。

4.content: 雷元素,是七元素之一。“雷”的名称Electro来源于与电相关的词汇的前缀“electro-”,源自古希腊语中“琥珀”的单词。

5.content: 草元素,是七元素之一。“草”的名称Dendro来源于生物学中与树木或植物相关的科学命名词汇的前缀“dendro-”,源自古希腊语中“树木”的单词。

6.content: 水元素,是七元素之一。“水”的名称Hydro来源于与水相关词汇的前缀“hydro-”,源自古希腊语中与水相关词汇的前缀。

7.content: 火元素,是七元素之一。“火”的名称Pyro来源于与火相关词汇的前缀“pyro-”,源自古希腊语中“火”的单词。

8.content: 冰元素,是七元素之一。“冰”的名称Cryo来源于与冰冻或冰相关词汇的前缀“cryo-”,源自古希腊语中“严寒”、“冷霜”、“寒冷”的单词。

9.content:
提瓦特中的某些生灵神秘地被赋予了神之眼,这些是外部装置,能让其主人掌握元素。神之眼呈水晶形式,每个都带有一个元素的符号和颜色。根据他们获得神之眼的地区,会呈现出那个地区的特征装饰。
当拥有神之眼的人死去时,他们的神之眼会成为无主的神之眼,失去力量和所有元素的标志。有时,无主的神之眼会与一个还未获得神之眼的人产生共鸣，使被选中的人获得神之眼。因此,无主的神之眼是非常富有的人所追求的商品。

10.content: 蒙德是提瓦特的七大区域之一。它所对应的主宰神是风神巴巴托斯,首都是蒙德城。一个自由之城,位于提瓦特的东北部。山峦与广阔平原间,无拘无束的微风带着蒲公英的香味——来自风神巴巴托斯的馈赠——吹过果酒湖,抵达坐落在湖心岛上的蒙德城。它的子区域有:晨曦酒庄、明冠山地、坠星山谷、苍风高地、风啸山坡和龙脊雪山。

11.content: 璃月是提瓦特的七大区域之一。它崇拜岩王帝君,岩之神钟离。一个丰饶的港口,位于提瓦特的东方。高耸的山脉伫立在石林之旁,与开阔的平原、奔涌的河流一起组成了璃月丰富多样的自然景观,在四季变换中每个时节都展示出独特的美丽。它的子区域有:天衡山区、璃沙郊盆地、层岩巨渊、珉林山区、碧水河沿岸平原区和轻策山区。

12.content: 稻妻是提瓦特的七大区域之一。它是一个崇拜雷电将军也就是雷之神巴尔的群岛区域,雷电将军也是其统治机构稻妻幕府的领袖。稻妻位于离璃月港东南约4公里,与暗之外海接壤。提瓦特远东的一个孤立群岛。战胜无尽的雷雨,才能踏足枫红叶与樱花盛开的岛屿。探索在蜿蜒的海岸和高耸的悬崖,充满秘密的森林与高山中。它的子区域有:鸣神岛、踏鞲砂、八酝岛、海祇岛、清籁岛以及鹤观岛,稻妻城坐落于鸣神岛并且后续还可以通过海祇岛进入特殊地区渊下宫

13.content: 暗之外海是指提瓦特大陆之外的任何地方的统称。由于不在提瓦特疆界内,居住在那里的人不生活在七神的统治之下。

14.content: 须弥是提瓦特的七大区域之一。它崇拜草之神，草神妠西妲, 草元素的主宰神。位于提瓦特中西部的学者之城。既有郁郁葱葱的雨林,也有荒无人烟的沙漠,充满无数睿智的果实与埋藏。无论是远道而来的旅行者穿过森林到达学院之城,亦或深入沙漠发现红砂的历史遗迹,在这里都有丰富的知识财富在等待着他们。主要区域有:护世森、道成林、阿陀河谷、善见地、二净甸、桓那兰那、失落的苗圃、赤王沙漠。

15.content:
天空岛是一个很少有人了解的神秘地点。它是可以在提瓦特天空中看到的漂浮小岛,也是神秘神灵的居所。
据说只有完成伟大英雄壮举的凡人才能登上天空岛并成神,在那里从高处守护自己的人民。拥有神之眼的人类和从其他世界而来的旅行者——是有可能达到神格的人。

16.content: 坎瑞亚,也被称为凯亚恩里亚王国,是一个未公开的区域。它不属于提瓦特大陆的一部分,也不在七神的监管范围内。坎瑞亚是一个没有神灵的国家——并不是因为它的神灵死亡或抛弃了他们,而是因为一开始它就没有神灵。这是一个仅仅由人类建立的强大国家,一个前所未有的繁荣光辉的文明——它是人类的骄傲。

17.content: 层岩矿区是位于璃月的层岩巨渊区域内的一个子区域和地区。在近期,一系列神秘事故导致整个矿区关闭,矿工失业。然而,璃月七星正在逐步重开该区域,允许矿工恢复工作。七星炉封印的巨渊之口下方是地下矿脉。

19.content: 原神中的敌人是可以被玩家击败的生物。它们可以根据难度类型(普通敌人、精英敌人、普通Boss、每周Boss)、种族(机械生命、深渊生物、元素生物、灵异兽类、丘丘人、盗宝团者、其他人类势力和著名敌人)或其他一些分类方式进行分类。

20.content: 原神中的物品是玩家可以获取的个别对象或单位。大多数物品可以从背包中获取。

21.content:
常见物品:
圣遗物 - 用于提高角色属性的装备。
名片 - 在玩家信息中显示的背景。
武器 - 角色用于攻击的装备。
角色培养素材 - 用于升级角色的物品。
食物 - 可以给角色和队伍吃来获得buff的物品。
药水 - 可以给队伍增加buff的物品。 
钓鱼竿 - 用于钓鱼的钓竿。
家具 - 可以放置在尘歌壶中的物体。
功能性道具 - 玩家用于和游戏世界互动的工具。
材料 - 在游戏世界中找到的,用于升级角色或制作其他物品的物品。
任务物品 - 在任务中获得的,用于提交或保留的物品。

22.content:
稀有物品:
探索物品 - 在探索中找到的用于提交的物品。
礼包 - 买来或赚取的物品包。
货币 - 用于和其他物品交换的物品。
圣遗物匣 - 用于获取圣遗物的物品。
元素印记 - 在每个区域的探索中找到的独特物品,可以用来交换。
非常特殊的物品 - 为旅行者准备的生日蛋糕。 
祈愿物品 - 用于进行祈愿的货币。

23.content: 原神中的宝箱是可以在提瓦特世界各地找到的对象。开启宝箱通常会奖励玩家原石、探险经验、元素印记、摩拉,以及随机的武器、圣遗物和角色培养素材。在某个区域开启一定数量的宝箱也会获得成就。宝箱的类型有:普通、精致、珍贵、华丽、绝美。另外,一些宝箱是隐藏的,需要从地下挖出。这些宝箱上会标有锹子或其他标志。盗宝团也是一个隐藏宝箱的指示器。当靠近他们所在位置时,会出现“挖掘”的选项,宝箱随后会出现。 一些宝箱被草元素结界覆盖,需要用火元素烧掉才能打开。其他一些宝箱被岩石覆盖,需要用重击、岩元素或瞬落攻击破坏才能打开。

24.content:
圣遗物是原神中可以装备在角色身上的物品,用于提高角色的属性。有5种类型的圣遗物可以装备:生之花、死之羽、时之沙、空之杯、理之冠。每种类型同一时间只能在一个角色上装备1个。它们从1星到5星,1星最弱,5星最强。
获取圣遗物的途径有:
调查点、
宝箱、
打碎风滚草、
击败精英敌人和Boss 、
领取祝福圣地中石化之树的奖励、
获取深境螺旋的星级悬赏。

25.content: 提瓦特的货币可以用来从商店购买物品。

26.content: 商店由出售物品给玩家的NPC经营。大多数商店每天都会补货。要查看每个商店提供的详细物品列表,可以访问商贩页面。

27.content:
摩拉是原神中用于购买各种物品和升级的主要货币单位。它也用于制作、提升圣遗物和培养角色。

这种货币在提瓦特全境通用。它也被认为是一种“催化剂”,可以带来物质上的转变,这也解释了它在制作中的用途。获得摩拉的方法有很多,它也是许多任务的常见奖励。这包括:

使用原粹树脂领取藏金之花的奖励
完成每日委托 
完成任务
开启宝箱
完成赏金任务和声望任务
击杀世界中的敌人
摧毁1星到4星圣遗物
完成各种活动

28.content:
冒险家协会是一个为提瓦特七国人民和其他组织提供雇佣冒险者服务的组织。协会将收集到的复杂的口头信息整理后,以任务和探险的形式分配给冒险者。

关于冒险家协会的起源知之甚少。然而,根据和凯瑟琳的对话,协会的总部位于稻妻。 

通过与凯瑟琳对话,玩家可以:

领取额外每日委托奖励
领取冒险阶级奖励

29.content: 用1到100的等级来衡量。等级越高,角色/怪物就越强大。

30.content: 通过任务、击败敌人和领取Boss奖励获得的EXP会赠予你队伍中的每个成员,不论他们是否参与战斗。不在你当前队伍中的角色将不会获得EXP。

31.content: 明冠山地是位于蒙德的一个区域。子区域包括:明冠峡和风龙废墟。

32.content:
明冠峡是位于明冠山地的蒙德的一个子区域。

峡谷的东北部有通向风龙废墟的东入口,风龙废墟之前是旧蒙德的都城。

33.content:
风龙废墟是位于明冠山地是蒙德的一个子区域。

它曾经是由高塔暴君统治的旧蒙德的都城。在一次起义中高塔暴君被击败后,巴巴托斯取代了他的位置,重新塑造了这片土地。人们随后将都城迁移到果酒湖中间的一个岛屿,即现在的蒙德城所在地。

500年前,在和被腐化的龙杜林的战斗中获胜但受了致命重伤的东风龙特瓦林,落入了前都城废墟的深眠中。然而,蒙德人忘记了他,当他重新醒来时,人们害怕他,称他为“风魔龙”——这也成为了这个区域叫风龙废墟的原因。加上杜林带来的毒血块的痛苦,让他受到了深渊教团的操纵。

34.content:
龙脊雪山, 历史上被称为温达格尼尔,是蒙德城中的一个地区。

它是一座广袤的雪山,布满了古老的废墟和积雪的地区,也包含着杜林的遗骸。在杜林堕落之前,它被称为温达格尼尔。

关于雪花在山上聚集却从未在这座雪山上融化,龙脊雪山有一些独特之处。由于气候异常寒冷,龙脊雪山也是蒙德城中最危险的地方之一。

35.content:
龙脊雪山的子区域有:

雪葬之都 - 旧宫, 雪葬之都 - 近郊, 覆雪之路, 星荧洞窟, 眠龙谷,寒天之钉

36.content: 烈风之高塔位于风龙废墟的中部,在探索空无大殿的主线任务中首次攀爬。顾名思义,这座塔曾是烈风魔神居住和审视他的子民的地方。

37.content: 风啸山坡是位于蒙德的一个区域。

38.content:
Starfell Valley is an area located in Mondstadt.

It is considered the most diverse region of Mondstadt,spreading far from the tip of Stormbearer Point to the ends of the Whispering Woods. It is also home to the City of Mondstadt in Cider Lake. The area also consists of abundant lakes and tree variety.

The area is where the Knights of Favonius's duties primarily takes place,protecting locals and travelers alike with guards patrolling around the area.

39.content: Starfell Valley subareas is: Cider Lake, City of Mondstadt, Starfell Lake, Starsnatch Cliff, Stormbearer Mountains, Stormbearer Point, Thousand Winds Temple, Whispering Woods

40.content:
Windwail Highland is an area located in Mondstadt.

It is home to the idyllic town of Springvale and the chief winery of Mondstadt, Dawn Winery. It also spans far across the wolf-ruled Wolvendom.

It is one of the more rustic areas around Mondstadt having clear springs, orchards and lush forests; until one reaches to Wolvendom, which is engulfed in higher enemy activity and is usually avoided by locals.

41.content: Windwail Highland subareas is: Dawn Winery, Springvale, Wolvendom

42.content:
Ancient Palace	An ancient city that lies silent beneath the eternal ice.
Look for clues and investigate the secret of a now-destroyed kingdom: Snow-Tombed Starsilver.

44.content: Nail is the area of Dragonspine's peak. Unlocking access to this area is part of the World Quest In the Mountains. Attempting to access this area early by scaling Dragonspine will result in Paimon remarking that it's far too cold before the player is forced to teleport away.

45.content: A snowy path leading deeper into Dragonspine

46.content: A great cavern spanning the depths of Dragonspine. Peculiar glowing vegetation grows throughout the cavern, illuminating even the deepest, darkest passages with its frigid glow.

47.content: The final resting place of the black dragon. The life force exuding from the dragon's core has dyed the steep valley's silvery snow in scarlet red. Has a glowing red cave of interest.

48.content: Galesong hill Subareas is: Cape Oath, Dadaupa Gorge, Falcon Coast, Musk Reef, Windrise

49.content: In the southeast corner of Mondstadt's surrounds lies a cape that borders with Galesong Hill.

50.content:
Home to three important hilichurl tribes: the Meaty tribe, the Sleeper tribe, and the Eclipse tribe.
Within it also lies the Sword Cemetery, which witnessed the battle against the monsters of Khaenri'ah.

51.content: Stretching eastward from Windrise to the sea, Falcon Coast — together with Cape Oath — shelters the sea from three sides, creating a bay that sits east of Mondstadt.

52.content: Located off Cape Oath. The main feature on the island is the entrance to the Spiral Abyss.

53.content: A plain believed to be the location where Vennessa had ascended to Celestia, where she became a god and now watches over Mondstadt as the Falcon of the West of the Four Winds. The massive oak tree is believed to have grown there after she ascended.

54.content: A natural freshwater lake that surrounds the City of Mondstadt.

55.content: Mondstadt is the main city of the namesake nation. Located in the west part of Starfell Valley on a large island in Cider Lake, Mondstadt features cobblestone streets and several windmills surrounded by a large stone castle wall on the east lower end. A statue of the Anemo Archon watches over the city, with the Favonius Cathedral in the back.

57.content: Located in the eastern part of Starfell Valley.

58.content: Located in the northern part of Starfell Valley, once a place to observe upcoming storms.

59.content: The northeasternmost area of Mondstadt. The coast just south of the area is where the Traveler begins their journey across Teyvat with Paimon.

60.content: An ancient amphitheater. It may have been used as an arena back in the Aristocratic Period, where slaves were made to fight each other for the satisfaction of the old nobles.

61.content: A small road cuts through these dense and deep woods, where the Traveler first meets Venti and Dvalin.

62.content: The chief winery in Mondstadt and specializes in Dandelion Wine. Owned by the Ragnvindr Clan for several generations, its current owner, Diluc, inherited it four years ago after the untimely passing of his father, Crepus.

63.content: A small town in the south east part of Windwail Highland, Springvale features dirt-paved areas and one-story tan houses with blue tiled roofs. One singular windmill watches over the town, with a naturally-occurring spring right below it.

64.content: Home to Andrius, Wolf of the North of the Four Winds, and his wolf pack.

65.content: Liyue areas is: Bishui Plain, Lisha, Minlin, Qiongji Estuary, Sea of Clouds, The Chasm, The Chasm: Underground Mines.

66.content:
Bishui Plain is an area located in Liyue.

The Bishui River passes through it.

67.content:
The Bishui River is a major river in Liyue that is primarily located in Bishui Plain but spans all areas except Lisha.

The Bishui River flows from northwest Liyue through Dihua Marsh where it splits, one part ending in the lake near Dawn Winery, the other in Qiongji Estuary where it flows into the Sea of Clouds. It has several tributaries.

68.content: There are 6 subareas in Bishui Plain: Dihua Marsh, Qingce Village, Sal Terrae, Stone Gate, Wangshu Inn, Wuwang Hill

69.content:
Dihua Marsh is an alluvial plane shaped by the Bishui River. It is south of Stone Gate and north of Wangshu Inn. Sal Terrae lies to the east.
There is a Statue of The Seven located on the northern end of Dihua Marsh, along the main road.

70.content:
This village is said to be a retirement spot for the elderly.[1] Due to the quietness, many people moved away in favor of other locations, leaving mostly elderly people watching over their grandchildren.
Buildings in Qingce Village have a simple architectural style, and most are made of wood with blue roofs. Qingce Village is home to a community center where Granny Ruoxin can be found, the mill owned by Ms. Bai, a tea shop owned by Pops Kai, the Fanmu Carpenter shop owned by Master Lu, and a market. The Qingce Village Bulletin Board is where advertisements and other postings by residents can be read.
The northwestern part of Qingce Village, located closer to the water, features a number of terraced fields of flowers. Glaze Lilies can be found there, as well as Slimes. According to legends, the terraced fields were the scales of the Chi.

71.content: It was founded by Havria, the God of Salt, and was the last sanctuary she presided over for her people after conceding much of her land during the Archon War in hopes of peace.

72.content: It is the convergence of the roads to Dawn Winery (northeast), Wuwang Hill and Qingce Village (northwest), and Dihua Marsh and Liyue Harbor (south).

73.content:
According to Zhongli, Wangshu Inn was built tall to provide visibility and is a strategic location that must be defended.
As most of the patrons that stop here are traveling merchants, the inn provides an area for them to trade and set up stalls. The view from the top of the inn is jaw-dropping — weather permitting, you can see all the way to Mt. Qingce and Jueyun Karst in the distance.
Legend amongst the stalls says that the tower of the inn hides a mysterious secret, but that's as far as the legend goes, as no one has ever been able to verify the claims.
The inn itself is run by Verr Goldet and her husband, Huai'an, who are both secret agents under the Liyue Qixing reporting directly to Ningguang. The commercial aspect of the inn is a front to their real task of covertly assisting Xiao in his excursions of excising plagues from Liyue.

74.content: The area is known for its eerie atmosphere, as the skies will always be dark gray regardless of whether it is daytime or nighttime.

75.content: Lisha (Chinese: 璃沙郊 Líshā-jiāo, "Glaze Sand Outskirts") is an area located in Liyue.

76.content: There are 3 subareas in Lisha:Dunyu Ruins, Lingju Pass, Qingxu Pool

77.content:
Pervases's Temple is a point of interest located in Lisha, Liyue.

It is a temple dedicated to the deceased Yaksha, Pervases, and contains a statue dedicated to him. It originally appears as a dilapidated house, before being restored upon the completion of World Quest Hereafter: All is Well in Series Hereafter.

78.content: It is one of the three locations where the Nameless Treasures can be found.

79.content: The area is mostly made of ruins with many puzzles to solve.

80.content: The ruins there are said to have been left behind by an evil god, and it was underwater until the end of the Archon War.

81.content: Minlin (Chinese: 珉林 Mínlín, "Forest of Jade-Like Stone") is an area located in Liyue.

82.content: Minlin Subareas is: Cuijue Slope, Jueyun Karst, Huaguang Stone Forest, Mt. Aocang, Mt. Hulao, Nantianmen, Qingyun Peak, Tianqiu Valley,

83.content: Located within the heart of this region are the Nine Pillars and a temple to the center. While within the vicinity of the pillars, the sky will darken.

84.content: It is said to be the place where the adepti live. Normally no one dares to try to set foot here, but some brave or desperate people still try to seek the adepti for good fortune.

85.content: Surrounded by three mountains: Mt. Aocang to the north, Qingyun Peak to the east, and Mt. Hulao to the southwest.

86.content: Home of the Adeptus Cloud Retainer.

87.content: The large pieces of Amber Rock found along the mountain are formed by flowers Mountain Shaper planted to keep out intruders.

88.content: This region notably features the Dragon-Queller, a large tree used to seal Azhdaha, whom Jiu worships. The dragon has begun merging with the tree, using its roots to connect to the ley lines and draw power from them.

89.content: Home of the Adeptus Moon Carver. Also features the Dwelling in the Clouds — a small floating island high above this mountain, which was created by Cloud Retainer at an unknown point in the past.

90.content: Located in the southeastern part of Minlin.

91.content: Qiongji Estuary (Chinese: 琼玑野 Qióngjī-yě) is an area located in Liyue.

92.content: Qiongji Estuary subareas is: Guili Plains, Luhua Pool, Mingyun Village, Yaoguang Shoal

93.content:
It was the central area of the Guili Assembly, the ancient civilization ruled by Guizhong, the God of Dust, and Morax, the God of Geo.
The location's name is derived from their names,[Note 1] and it is also called the Plains of Returning and Departing based on the characters taken from their names.
During the Archon War, Guizhong died trying to defend her people, and the place was destroyed. After her death, Rex Lapis took his people and brought them south of Mt. Tianheng, where he established Liyue Harbor.

94.content: It is a unique landscape consisting of brightly-colored pools, watched over by two statues.

95.content:
It is home to several scattered mining deposits, but many of them have since dried up, with the remaining few ores unable to keep up the village's survival. The inhabitants have since left westward towards Liyue Harbor and The Chasm for a better opportunity. Hilichurls have since moved in to the area to make use of the leftover facilities.
Three small mining tunnels exist in the area around the village where one can find deposits of Iron Chunks, Noctilucous Jade, and Cor Lapis.

96.content:
It lies south of Mingyun Village and east of Guili Plains.
To the far east side of Yaoguang Shoal is an unnamed "hidden" location dubbed Heart Island by players, for the heart-shaped puzzle located on the island. Unlocking the Luxurious Chest buried on the island requires standing on the heart with another player in Co-Op, and grants the Wonders of the World achievement Unswerving.

97.content: The Sea of Clouds is an area located in Liyue.

98.content: Sea of Clouds subareas is: Guyun Stone Forest, Liyue Harbor, Mt. Tianheng

99.content:
An archipelago of seven large islands and smaller offshoots.
According to legend, this is where Rex Lapis defeated a god and sea monster known as Osial, and the jagged cliffs protruding from the islands at Guyun are in fact the remnants of the stone lances he used in that battle.

100.content:
The main city of the Liyue nation.
During the Archon War, after Guizhong died, Rex Lapis brought his people south of Mt. Tianheng, to found what is now known as Liyue Harbor.

101.content: A mountain west of Liyue Harbor, raised by Morax when he first descended upon Liyue, and there people congregated to mine ore from the mountains.

102.content: Sea of Clouds Points of Interest is: Alcor, Feiyun Slope, Chihu Rock, Yujing Terrace, Emerald Maple Inn, Golden House

103.content: The flagship of The Crux. While it is normally helmed by Captain Beidou, she has returned to Liyue Harbor for business and left the ship to her men.

104.content:
The Crux (Chinese: 南十字 Nánshízì, "The Southern Cross") is an armed fleet based in Liyue Harbor and led by Captain Beidou. The Crux is famous throughout Liyue for their daring adventures and rich bounties.
Its flagship, the Alcor, can be found (and boarded) off the shores of Guyun Stone Forest, by the southeastern end of the island Domain of Guyun is on.

105.content: Feiyun Slope is the northeastern area in Liyue Harbor. It is the first area entered upon entering Liyue Harbor via the main road from Mondstadt. A sloped staircase separates the upper and lower levels of the area. From the northern Teleport Waypoint in Liyue Harbor, turn left at the T-section to enter the upper Feiyun Slope area.

106.content: Chihu Rock is the southern end of Liyue Harbor, between Feiyun Slope and the South Wharf. It is primarily a commercial area where many stores and vendors can be found.

107.content: Yujing Terrace is the area on the northwestern side of Liyue Harbor, to the left of the northern Teleport Waypoint on the World Map. After teleporting to that waypoint, head straight and turn right.

108.content: The Emerald Maple Inn is an inn located west of the Statue of The Seven at the Sea of Clouds, Liyue, and overlooks Luhua Pool. Due to its relatively remote location, its proprietor, Mr. Zhu, struggles to get patrons.

109.content: The Golden House is where all of Teyvat's Mora is minted. When Rex Lapis died, his corpse, the Exuvia, was moved here by the Liyue Qixing.

110.content: The chasm Subareas is: Cinnabar Cliff, Fuao Vale, Glaze Peak, Lumberpick Valley, The Chasm's Maw, The Surface, Tiangong Gorge

111.content: Cinnabar Cliff is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue. Cinnabar Cliff is considered a tourist spot, but locals never go there.[

112.content: Fuao Vale (Chinese: 伏鳌谷 Fú'áo-gǔ) is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue. This is the site of the deadly battle between Azhdaha and Rex Lapis.

113.content: Glaze Peak is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue.

114.content: Lumberpick Valley is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue.

115.content:
The Chasm's Maw is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue.
It serves as the entrance to The Chasm's underground mines.

116.content: The Surface is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue.

117.content: Tiangong Gorge is a subarea located in The Chasm, Liyue.

118.content: The Chasm: Underground Mines subareas is: Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel, Nameless Ruins, Stony Halls, The Chasm: Main Mining Area, The Glowing Narrows, The Serpent's Cave, Underground Waterway.

119.content: The Chasm: Underground Mines Points of Interest is: Chasm Exploration Team Camp, Spiritstone, The Chasm's Bed, The Chasm Withered Tree.

120.content: The entrance to the Chasm's Underground Mines. It consists of large tunnels with platforms on both sides, it functions as a passageway to The Chasm: Main Mining Area.

121.content: Relics of an ancient civilization with ties to Khaenri'ah. The entire structure is upside down, fixed to the ceiling for unknown reasons. There are plethora of tunnels connecting it to many other deeper areas.

122.content: A sphere shaped cave with a Spiritstone shard in the center, the crystal has seemingly affected the surroundings to create a spiraling rock formation around itself. The pit below it leads to the Nameless Ruins.

123.content: A spacious and large area west of the Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel. It is where most of the ore is dug from and where most activity in the Chasm is centered around. A blocked tunnel at the end leads to the Stony Halls.

124.content: A cave system located at the deepest levels of the Chasm, the name is derived from a great many number of glowing plants present there. It is the last area before the Spiritstone.

125.content: A dug cave with many smaller caverns on all sides, it was excavated by a Ruin Serpent. It is connected to Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel via a tunnel in the north and one in the east.

126.content: A system of water bodies located south of the Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel, it has an abundance of flora due to its high moisture.

127.content: Located at the Icon Refine Adjuvant. The camp set up by the Chasm Exploration Team while investigating the underground mines.

128.content: Located west of The Glowing Narrows. It resembles the Skyfrost Nail.

129.content: Located east of The Chasm: Main Mining Area. The Shriveled Seed can be obtained at this location.

130.content: An area of distorted spacetime located right under the Spiritstone, accessed during the Archon Quest Interlude Chapter: Act II - Perilous Trail.

131.content: Located north of The Chasm: Main Mining Area. It looks like the ancient white tree from Dragonspine.

132.content:
Enkanomiya (Japanese: 淵下宮 Enkanomiya, "Palace Below the Depths"), originally known as Byakuyakoku (Japanese: 白夜国 Byakuyakoku, "Land of the White Night / Midnight Sun")[1] and Tokoyokoku (Japanese: 常世国 Tokoyokoku, "Eternal Country"), is an area located in Inazuma.
It can be entered via a deep pool east of Sangonomiya Shrine, and legend has it that the Watatsumi people originated from here.[2] Enkanomiya is located under Watatsumi Island, and can be considered either part of Teyvat even though it is somewhat disconnected from it, or fully separate and part of the Dark Sea instead.
To enter Enkanomiya, the seals on the five Goshou Rocks need to be broken for the pearls located within the shrines for the Key of the Moon-Bathed Deep, which would allow entry to Enkanomiya, provided that the spirit veins connecting Enkanomiya and Watatsumi Island are flowing smoothly and a person whose heart is "as clear as water." According to legend, the key was forged from Orobashi's blood.

133.content: Enkanomiya subareas is: Dainichi Mikoshi, Evernight Temple, The Narrows, The Serpent's Bowels, The Serpent's Heart, Yachimatahiko's Locus, Yachimatahime's Locus, Kunado's Locus.

134.content: enkanomiya Points of Interest is: Dragonbone Flower, The Altar at The Serpent's Heart, The Emanant Skylight, Tokoyo Reisen, Vishap Research Lab	.

135.content: The central area of Enkanomiya, named after Enkanomiya's artificial sun that was created by Aberaku no Mikoto in order to protect Byakuyakoku from the Dragonheir of the Depths.

138.content: The pathway towards the main areas of Enkanomiya.

140.content: The northernmost area of Enkanomiya. It is initially hidden from the map and can be unlocked and shown on the map by starting the Erebos' Secret questline.

141.content: The northeasternmost area of Enkanomiya. It is initially hidden from the map and can be unlocked and shown on the map by starting the Erebos' Secret questline.

142.content: The southernmost area of Enkanomiya. It is initially hidden from the map and can be unlocked and shown on the map by starting the Erebos' Secret questline.

143.content: A giant flower in The Serpent's Bowels. In the world quest Lotus Eater, the Traveler waters this flower using the Waters of Lethe to obtain the Dragonbone Orb.

144.content: Used to enter in Altar Patterns to obtain rewards or advance a quest.

145.content: Found in The Narrows, Evernight Temple, and The Serpent's Heart. Ghostfish here can be used to will lift the player up towards a Time Tunnel which will take them to one of the three locuses.

146.content: Located north of Dainichi Mikoshi. This area is not marked on the map.

147.content:
Kannazuka (Japanese: 神かん無な塚づか Kanna-dzuka) is an area located in Inazuma.
Behind the rocky outcrops lies Mikage Furnace, the largest smelting facility in Inazuma and is also home to the battlefront fortress of the Shogunate's forces.
It is considered to be disputed territory between the Inazuma Shogunate and the Watatsumi Army. The area neither belongs to both armies and neither Inazuman faith nor Sangonomiya faith has any influence. For this reason, this area is called Kannazuka, which means "the hill where no gods reside."

148.content: Kannazuka subareas is: Tatarasuna, Kujou Encampment

149.content: Kannazuka Points of Interest is: Mikage Furnace, The Arsenal

150.content:
Legend has it that Kannazuka means "the hill where no gods reside." Until now, Kannazuka is disputed territory between the Shogunate and Sangonomiya.
Kannazuka has a mountainous terrain with high steep cliffs. In the midst of the rocky outcrops lies Mikage Furnace, the largest smelting facility in Inazuma. This is where Jade Steel is made, a rare material that is used in Inazuma to forge swords.

151.content:
The Shogunate's military camp in Kannazuka.
There will always be an irreconcilable conflict between the people of Narukami who believe in the Raiden Shogun and the people of Sangonomiya who believe in Watatsumi Omikami. The strife between both parties has only worsened since the Vision Hunt Decree was enforced.
To put down the Sangonomiya rebellion, the Tenryou Commission has stationed the Shogun's Army here. Compared to the Sangonomiya forces, the Shogun's Army has more troops, is better trained, and is well-equipped. Victory seems assured for the latter.

152.content: Revealed as a sneak peek in the Version 1.5 Special Program as: "The largest smelting facility in all the islands of Inazuma, surrounded by jagged, rocky terrain. War has brought production to a halt."

153.content: A cave located underneath Tatarasuna, near the Mikage Furnace.

154.content:
Narukami Island (Japanese: 鳴なる神かみ島じま Narukami-jima) is an area located in Inazuma.
The area spans across Ritou, its port of entry, to Mt. Yougou which is home to the Grand Narukami Shrine, and on its coast is Inazuma City. It also has a mass of dense forests under the moonlight and underwater ruins alike.
It is where the Inazuma Shogunate primarily takes rule, enforcing policies and laws in accordance to the Sakoku Decree. Inazuman public festivals and cultural events are being held here.

155.content: Narukami subareas is: Amakane Island, Araumi, Byakko Plain, Chinju Forest, Jinren Island, Inazuma City, Mt. Yougou, Grand Narukami Shrine, Ritou, Konda Village, Kamisato Estate.

156.content: Narukami Points of Interest is: Depths of Mt. Yougou, Hanamizaka, Sacred Sakura, Tenryou, Tenshukaku, Uyuu Restaurant.

157.content: Amakane Island A festival island located to the north-west of Inazuma City.

159.content: Separating Konda Village and Inazuma City, many wild foxes can be found here.

160.content:
A tranquil and mysterious forest located at the foot of Mt. Yougou.
Here one can find Tanuki statues everywhere, torii gates scattered throughout the forest, and abandoned shrines hidden in the depths... Like a flowing river, they tell of legends meandering into a forgotten past.
Rumor has it that when walking in Chinju Forest, you may encounter mysterious beings who like to play pranks...

161.content: A group of broken isles at the northernmost tip of Inazuma.

162.content:
Inazuma's most lively and prosperous area, where most of Inazuma's population lives. From Hanamizaka to the streets of the city, you can follow the trail to visit local traditional shops and sample Inazuma specialties.
The Tenryou Commission is also located in the city, governing matters concerning public order and security, as well as the Shogunate's military affairs.
At the top of Inazuma City is Tenshukaku, where the Raiden Shogun resides and rules over Inazuma.

163.content: A mountain on Narukami Island, home to the Grand Narukami Shrine and Sacred Sakura.

164.content:
The largest shrine in Inazuma, located at the peak of Mt. Yougou. It is dedicated to Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho.
For those who have wishes, they can climb to the top of the mountain one step at a time. For those who have gained the favor of Electro, they can use the Thunder Spheres to fly up and reach the shrine surrounded by the huge Sacred Sakura Tree. The Sacred Sakura is in constant bloom, symbolizing the eternity of Narukami.
After passing through the many torii gates, find the shrine maiden to draw a fortune slip and ask for Narukami's blessing.

165.content:
To properly explore the realm of the Shogun during this time of the Sakoku Decree, you must first pass the checkpoint in Ritou.
Ritou is under the jurisdiction of the Kanjou Commission and people need various documents to be granted passage. However, to get the necessary Travel Permit, you have to go through a very complicated procedure and have the right connections.
Without the Travel Permit, you can only stop briefly in Ritou. You will see other outlanders who are also stuck there, together looking out upon the desolate landscape of the fishing village with red maples and green roof tiles.

166.content: A small village located outside of Inazuma City.

167.content: The residence of the Kamisato Clan that oversees the Yashiro Commission.

168.content: Mentioned as a sneak peek in the Version 1.6 Special Program as: "The plant life here has grown gnarled and unnatural from growing in uttermost darkness. Something twisted seems to be sealed here."

169.content: Hanamizaka occupies the outskirts of Inazuma City between Byakko Plain and Tenryou.

170.content: Sakura Tree located in the Grand Narukami Shrine.

171.content: City	Among the streets of Tenryou is the famous Commercial Street — the busiest street in all of Inazuma.

172.content: The Tenshukaku compound occupies the southern half of Inazuma City. It is the highest point in the city and serves as the residence of the Raiden Shogun and as the headquarters of the Tenryou Commission.

173.content: A restaurant referred to in Someone's Drifting Bottle and located in Hanamizaka.

174.content:
Seirai Island (Japanese: セイライ島じま Seirai-jima) is an area located in Inazuma.
It is said that the island once experienced a calamity and the center of the island was enveloped by a perpetual thunderstorm. This storm has resulted in the unique geography of the island. Until the Seirai Stormchasers quest series is completed, the center of the island is constantly afflicted with Balethunder and lightning that targets the player. Even after completing the quest series, Electro Water will still persist at the center of the island, although it can be cleared by a nearby puzzle, which will reveal a large hole in the middle.

175.content: Seirai Island subareas is: Amakumo Peak, Asase Shrine, Fort Hiraumi, Koseki Village, Seiraimaru.

176.content: Seirai Island Points of Interest is: The Summit, The Lake, Underground Ruins.

177.content: Long ago, Kanna Kapatcir was slain here, while the power of its lingering hatred and regret was suppressed by wards maintained by the Asase Shrine. During the Seirai Rebellion around 500 years ago, Asase Hibiki unsealed the wards, causing the Thunder Manifestation to appear and devastate the area with a massive Electro storm.

178.content: The shrine was established to suppress the lingering power of Kanna Kapatcir, also known as the Thunderbird.

179.content: Located in the northeastern part of Seirai Island.

181.content: The area takes its name after the "Seiraimaru," the flagship of Ako Domeki's fleet which was destroyed here.

182.content: The fragmented summit of Amakumo Peak is now home to the Thunder Manifestation.

183.content: The lake at the base of Amakumo Peak is filled with Electro Water and the surrounding area is roamed by many Ruin Sentinels. However, by solving the Light-Up Tile Puzzle, a mechanism is unlocked that drains the water from the area and nullifies its Electro effect. After being drained, ruins leading to an underground settlement are revealed.

184.content: Available after draining the lake at Amakumo Peak.

185.content:
Tsurumi Island (Japanese: 鶴つる観み Tsurumi) is an area located in Inazuma.

Shrouded in a dense Fog, Tsurumi Island was home to two ancient civilizations. One buried deep underground, before the time of the Thunderbird's reign, known as the Pre-Thunderbird Civilization. The other coming some time after, the civilization where a tribe worshipped Kanna Kapatcir (becoming known as the Thunderbird Civilization) and were subsequently wiped out by it. The land has since somewhat regrown and is now inhabited by hilichurls, riftwolves and automatons.

186.content: Tsurumi Island subareas is: Autake Plains, Chirai Shrine, Moshiri Ceremonial Site, Mt. Kanna, Oina Beach, Shirikoro Peak, Wakukau Shoal.

187.content:
Autake Plains (Japanese: アウタケ平原 Autake Heigen) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.
Most of Autake Plains was covered by an unremovable Fog, even after the completion of A Particularly Particular Author; if the Player stays inside the fog for too long without a Stormstone nearby, they will be teleported to the nearest Teleport Waypoint outside of the fog.
After the completion of The Sun-Wheel and Mt. Kanna, the fog will permanently disappear, allowing easier exploration.

188.content: Chirai Shrine (Japanese: チライ社殿 Chirai Shaden) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.

189.content: Moshiri Ceremonial Site (Japanese: モシリ祭場 Moshiri Saijou) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.

190.content: Mt. Kanna (Japanese: カンナ山 Kanna-zan) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.

191.content: Oina Beach (Japanese: オイナ海岸 Oina Kaigan) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.

192.content: Shirikoro Peak (Japanese: シリコロ山 Shirikoro-zan) is a subarea located in Tsurumi Island, Inazuma.

193.content: Wakukau Shoal (Japanese: ワクカウ浜 Wakukau-hama) is a subarea of Tsurumi Island.

194.content:
Watatsumi Island (Japanese: 海祇わたつみ島じま Watatsumi-jima) is an area located in Inazuma.
Among these islands, it is located the farthest and on the opposite end of Narukami Island. It is known for its dense foliage in breathtaking colors which are distinct from plants found elsewhere.

195.content: Watatsumi Island subareas is: Sangonomiya Shrine, Suigetsu Pool, Bourou Village, Mouun Shrine.

196.content: A shrine located at the center of Watatsumi Island.

197.content: Located in the northeastern part of Watatsumi Island.

198.content: A small village located in the southern part of Watatsumi Island. It served as the camp where soldiers were trained during the Watatsumi Army's fight against the Shogunate.

199.content: An abandoned shrine in the western part of Watatsumi Island.

200.content:
Yashiori Island (Japanese: ヤシオリ島 Yashiori-jima) is an area located in Inazuma.
At some point within the last two thousand years, the island was attacked by the Watatsumi Omikami Orobashi no Mikoto, an ancient god who created Watatsumi Island.
As a result of the heavy concentration of Tatarigami energy, the island suffers from torrential rainfall and frequent thunderstorms in the open, which in turn applies constant Wet status. Getting hit by a thunderstorm while raining can cause Electro-Charged. Until the quest Orobashi's Legacy is fully completed, this abnormal weather will remain on the island.

201.content: Yashiori Island subareas is: Fort Fujitou, Fort Mumei, Higi Village, Jakotsu Mine, Serpent's Head, Musoujin Gorge, Nazuchi Beach.

202.content: Yashiori Island Points of Interest is: Chouji's House

203.content: A military camp previously occupied by the Watatsumi Army.

204.content: A ruined area at the east side of Yashiori Island.

206.content: The southernmost area of Yashiori Island

207.content:
Of the giant serpent that was defeated by the Electro Archon with the Musou no Hitotachi, only its weather-bleached remains are left today.
Although its skull still looks up at the sky defiantly, the god is already dead, and so the name of "Watatsumi Omikami" is gradually being forgotten.
Even if the giant serpent is long dead, you can still clearly feel the traces of its power left behind. Under the influence of the Tatarigami, Yashiori Island has been deserted by its inhabitants. What can be seen on the island are just endless rain and thunderstorms trying to wash away the remnants of the past.

208.content:
This narrow and majestic rift valley runs through the eastern part of Yashiori Island.
This extraordinary sight is no natural formation, but rather is the result of the fight in which the Electro Archon slayed the giant serpent. The rift valley is named after the Musou no Hitotachi, a testament to the Electro Archon's skilled swordsmanship.
To this day, the remains of the giant serpent are still scattered throughout Yashiori Island. The Tatarigami that emerged from this god's remains seem to be awakening...

209.content:
Located between Yashiori Island and Kannazuka, Nazuchi Beach is a place ravaged by war. On the shallow coast, apart from Violet Ibis looking for a place to rest, there are torn flags and broken arrows of prior battles, as well as broken masts and shattered deck of shipwrecks.
As a result of the war, pirates and ronin infest the place searching for loot. Even the rare Dendrobium blooms in this place...

210.content: The former residence of Chouji's family.

211.content: sumeru subregion is: Dharma Forest, Great Red Sand, Girdle of the Sands.

212.content:
Dharma Forest is a subregion located in Sumeru. It is the rainforest subregion for this nation. A fragrant wind comes from the west of the rainforest, carrying stories that have never been heard.
The nation of wisdom sleeps soundly under the green veil, and all creatures sing under the cleansing rainwater. Amidst the luxuriant branches and leaves, the new chapter of the journey unfolds.

213.content: Dharma Forest Subares is: Ardravi Valley, Ashavan Realm, Avidya Forest, Lokapala Jungle, Lost Nursery, Vanarana, Vissudha Field.

214.content: Ardravi Valley is an area located in Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

215.content: Ardravi Valley Point of interest is: Dev's Cavern, Djafar Tavern, Pharos Lighthouse, Port Ormos Bulletin Board, Ruin Golem (Devantaka Mountain), Shapur Hotel, Wikala Funduq.

216.content: Ardravi Valley Subares is: Devantaka Mountain, Port Ormos, Vimara Village.

217.content:
Devantaka Mountain is home to a massive Ruin Golem, which the legendary scholar Pir Kavikavus once researched, resulting in a terrible accident.
The Akasha System has no signal while on the mountain.

218.content:
Port Ormos is the largest port in Sumeru and serves as a hub for trading and travel. It is located beneath two giant trees, between which a river runs from Sumeru City to the port.
Though parts of Port Ormos are under the supervision of the Akademiya, smuggling and other illegal activity is more common at Port Ormos than in Sumeru City. Prices also tend to be lower than in Sumeru City. Most long-term residents in the port are traders and laborers who grew up in the area, but a number of Eremite merceneries from various factions can also be found there. Students often come to the port when academic life gets too stressful, and it is even considered good luck to some.

219.content: Vimara Village is a small, tranquil fishing town on the river between Sumeru City and Port Ormos, and many caravans pass through the village while traveling between the two.

220.content: Dev's Cavern is a point of interest located in Ardravi Valley, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

221.content: Djafar Tavern is a point of interest located in Port Ormos, Ardravi Valley, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

222.content: Pharos Lighthouse is a point of interest located in Port Ormos, Ardravi Valley, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

223.content: Port Ormos Bulletin Board, It can be found near Shapur Hotel. The messages randomly cycle through every time it is interacted with.

224.content: The Ruin Golem at Devantaka Mountain, Sumeru is one of three known Ruin Golems located in the Sumeru region, alongside the Ruin Golems at Valley of Dahri and Desert of Hadramaveth. It is featured during the World Quest Vimana Agama.

225.content: Wikala Funduq is located towards the southeastern side of the port. It is the port's trade hub and the center of Sumeru's commerce. It is under the control of the Sumeru Akademiya

226.content: Ashavan Realm Point of interest is: Caravan Ribat Bulletin Board, Grove of Dreams, Memory of Stone (Monument), The Rain's End.

227.content: Ashavan Realm Subares is: Apam Woods, Caravan Ribat, Pardis Dhyai, Ruins of Dahri, Yasna Monument.

228.content: It is a massive rainforest with trees that stretch towards the sky. After completing the World Quest A Prayer for Rain on the Fecund Land, the player will be able to operate the Varuna Contraption and control the rain.

229.content: A fortified village at the foot of a tall wall that blocks the sandstorms from destroying the Sumeru rainforests. Located at the foot of the Wall of Samiel, Caravan Ribat serves as a thoroughfare for those coming from the forest going to Aaru Village, and vice versa.

230.content: It is a research site for Amurta scholars.

231.content: is a subarea located in Ashavan Realm, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

232.content: is a subarea located in Ashavan Realm, Dharma Forest, Sumeru. There is 1 point of interest in Yasna Monument: Memory of Stone (Monument), It is a memorial plaque set up by the Aranara for Nara Varuna to leave a visible memory for them that shows that Vana and the Aranara never forget their adventures with the Aranara.

233.content: The Grove of Dreams is a place where a way to enter dreams is said to reside.[1] Like Vanarana, it has both a real and a dream version, and players can switch between the two by playing the Rhythm of the Great Dream with the Vintage Lyre at a Silapna.

234.content: It is unlocked during the Varuna Gatha World Quest Series, and is where the player first gains access to the Varuna Contraption.

235.content:
Avidya Forest is an area located in Dharma Forest, Sumeru.
Avidya Forest is a lush, green forest located in eastern Sumeru. It is the main area and most populous section of Sumeru apart from Ardravi Valley. The forest is also home to Sumeru City which houses The Akademiya, and Gandharva Ville, which is the base of the Forest Watchers. The Forest Watchers have guarded the forest for many years in order to ensure the forest's survival.
Many unique flora and fauna grow in the Avidya Forest, such as Padisarahs, Nilopata Lotuses or Rukkhashava Mushrooms. Apart from Flowers, there are also different species and breeds of animals found, like Shroomboars. In the forest, you wil also find many, many special breeds of Shroomkin out in the wild.
The Avidya Forest is also the first area in Sumeru that the Traveler enters.

236.content: Avidya Forest Subares is: Chinvat Ravine, Gandha Hill, Gandharva Ville, Sumeru City, Yazadaha Pool.

237.content: It is a ravine located below Sumeru City, at the base of the Divine Tree.

238.content: Gandha Hill is a subarea located in Avidya Forest, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

239.content: Also called "The City Above the Forest," it is the main outpost of Forest Rangers and is often frequented by travelers, merchants, and adventurers.

240.content:
Sumeru City is known across Teyvat as the "City of Wisdom." It is under the jurisdiction of the Sumeru Akademiya and is built on top of the Divine Tree.
The city features many districts and points of interest, such as the Grand Bazaar, Zubayr Theater, Treasures Street, and more. Located in the middle to top half of the tree is The Akademiya, which serves as the main base of the Sumeru Akademiya. On top of The Akademiya rests the Sanctuary of Surasthana, which is a treetop palace where Lesser Lord Kusanali resides.

241.content: is a subarea located in Avidya Forest, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

242.content: is an area located in Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

243.content: Lokapala Jungle Point of interest is: Mawtiyima, Realm of Khab.

244.content: Lokapala Jungle Subares is: Chatrakam Cave, Mawtiyima Forest, The Palace of Alcazarzaray.

245.content: Chatrakam Cave is best known for containing a large number of Fungi, and humans typically do not go inside.

246.content:
It is a forest made of enormous fluorescent mushrooms.
Mawtiyima is described as "an energy form created by the ancient dreams and memories of the forest." This energy fights against The Withering to ensure the health of the forest, and even seems to be able to communicate with the Aranara. In an ancient tongue, the name once meant "human death."

247.content: The Palace of Alcazarzaray is owned by Dori. It was designed by Kaveh and is considered to be his magnum opus.

248.content: Before completing the World Quest The Final Chapter, Mawtiyima is inaccessible. During The Final Chapter, the Traveler offers the Arahaoma to Jamikayomars, unlocking the entrance to Mawtiyima, which is infected by The Withering. The Traveler aids Aranakin, Aragaru, and Aranaga in cleaning up the pollution caused by The Withering. After completing The Final Chapter, the area is freely accessible.

249.content: It is said that the Realm of Khab is the convergence of the memories of Nara Varuna and Aranara, becoming the place where the dreams of the Barsam Flower gather.

250.content: Lost Nursery is an area located in Dharma Forest, Sumeru.

251.content: Lost Nursery Point of interest is: Land of Grounded Dreams, Sand-Embraced Home.

252.content: Lost Nursery Subares is: Old Vanarana.

253.content: It was the home of the Aranara for hundreds of years before the cataclysm.

254.content: Marana's Avatar is located here until its defeat, after which Arama plants themselves here to become the new Ashvattha Tree.

255.content: It can be reached by going down from the northern Teleport Waypoint in Old Vanarana.

256.content:
Vanarana is an area and a subarea located in Vanarana, Dharma Forest, Sumeru.
There are two different versions of Vanarana: the one that exists in reality, and the dream version where the Aranara live (which is called Mahavanaranapna).

257.content:
The Aranara are a race of plantlike forest spirits who reside in Vanarana in northern Sumeru. They are encountered in the World Quest series Aranyaka.
They were led by Greater Lord Rukkhadevata — whom they called "Queen Aranyani" — up until her disappearance.
After Lesser Lord Kusanali erased the memory of Greater Lord Rukkhadevata from the Irminsul during Where the Boat of Consciousness Lies, like any Teyvatian creatures, the Aranara also forgot her as Queen Aranyani, believing instead that they are the children of the current Dendro Archon, whom they refer to as The Lord of Verdure.

258.content: Vanarana Point of interest is: Tree of Dreams, Araja's house, Arama's house, Music-Loving Aranaras' house, Aranakin's group's house, Arapandu's group's house, Ararycan's house, Arapacati's group's house, Viparyas's garden.

259.content: A mystic plant that grows in the heart of the forest. Seems to be sentient.

262.content: Vissudha Field is an area located in Dharma Forest, Sumeru. it has 1 subareas: Fane of Ashvattha.

263.content: It is the first Vasara Tree, and it acts as the seal for the entrance to Old Vanarana.

264.content:
Great Red Sand is a subregion located in Sumeru. It is the desert subregion for this nation. Crossing sand and searing wind, traversing thicket and forest, you reach a ruined city that was once part of a kingdom of gilded desert.
Though the mirage has faded, the ancient dreams and secrets yet slumber under the shifting sands.

265.content: Great Red Sand Subares is: Desert of Hadramaveth, Hypostyle Desert, Land of Lower Setekh, Land of Upper Setekh.

266.content: Desert of Hadramaveth is an area located in Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

267.content: Desert of Hadramaveth Point of interest is: Apep's Resort, Bayt Al-Hayah, Bayt Al-Muazzam, Bayt Al-Sukr, Deshret's Glass Goblet, Liloupar's Cell, Pairidaeza Canyon, Ruin Golem, The Orchard of Pairidaeza, Wenut Tunnels.

268.content: Desert of Hadramaveth Subares is: Debris of Panjvahe, Dunes of Steel, Gurabad's Ruin - Temple of Deshret, Mt. Damavand, Passage of Ghouls, Qusayr Al-Inkhida', Safhe Shatranj, Tanit Camps, The Sands of Al-Azif, The Sands of Three Canals, Wadi Al-Majuj, Wounded Shin Valley.

269.content: is a subarea located in Desert of Hadramaveth, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

270.content: This is the area of the Desert of Hadramaveth that connects it to Old Vanarana.

271.content: is a subarea located in Desert of Hadramaveth, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

272.content: A passage depressed between two cliffs that connects Wadi Al-Majuj to The Sands of Al-Azif.

273.content: is a subarea located in Desert of Hadramaveth, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

274.content: Prior to World Quest The Temple Where Sand Flows Like Tears in Series The Dirge of Bilqis, the subarea is named The Temples Forsaken. During this quest, the name is changed and the sand is cleared.

275.content: It is home to the Tanit tribe. After completing the World Quest Her Foes Rage Like Great Waters..., the Tanit are removed from the area, with the Vahumana Tanjiyy replacing them.

276.content: One of the flatter areas of the desert, home to many roaming Wenut on the surface and the Wenut Tunnels below.

277.content: An elevated area of the Desert of Hadramaveth north of Mt. Damavand.

278.content: It is an area south of Mt. Damavand with a large canyon running through it.

279.content: is a subarea located in Desert of Hadramaveth, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

280.content: It is a large and mysterious cavern in the northernmost part of the Desert of Hadramaveth.

281.content: These are the caverns beneath Wounded Shin Valley that lead into Deshret's Glass Goblet.

282.content: These are the caverns beneath Qusayr Al-Inkhida' that lead into Deshret's Glass Goblet.

283.content: These are the caverns beneath The Sands of Three Canals that lead into Deshret's Glass Goblet.

284.content: It is first shown during the World Quest Dune-Entombed Fecundity: Part I in Series The Dirge of Bilqis.

285.content: is a point of interest located in Safhe Shatranj, Desert of Hadramaveth, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

286.content: A canyon that cuts through Wadi Al-Majuj, the Pairidaeza Canyon has parts that are exposed to the sky and occupied by some Eremite camps and parts underground which have a basin of shallow water. The canyon leads into Liloupar's Cell.

287.content:
It is one of three known Ruin Golems located in the Sumeru region, alongside the Ruin Golems at Devantaka Mountain and Valley of Dahri.
Unlike the other two Ruin Golems, this Ruin Golem is in far better structural and functional condition. Initially situated at Dunes of Steel, it was still capable of traversal upon reactivation, and during the World Quest The Dirge of Bilqis, the player relocates it to an area north of The Sands of Three Canals, then finally Wounded Shin Valley.
Upon sinking into the ground at Wounded Shin Valley, the Ruin Golem permanently loses all mobility and its ability to punch, though its eye cannon can still be operated freely like the Ruin Golem at Valley of Dahri.

288.content:
The oasis was created by King Deshret as a cemetery for the Goddess of Flowers, preserved for eternity in a single moment.
The oasis lies beneath Mount Damavand and can only be entered through Deshret's Glass Goblet, which is located beneath it.
The Traveler visits the Eternal Oasis with Jeht in the World Quest The Eternal Dream, Ever Lush. She leaves her father's axe and her mother's notes next to a tree there, where they can be found from that point forward.
There are three chairs in the middle of the oasis, one for each of the three God-Kings of Sumeru. Abbreviated forms of their names are written in Deshret Script on the chairs.

289.content: It is the system of caverns below The Sands of Al-Azif that are home to the dangerous Wenut.

290.content: Hypostyle Desert Point of interest is: Aaru's Shut, Duat Hall, Great Hall of Truths, Opet Hall, Place of Breath, Place of Rebirth, Place of Swallowing, Sekhem Hall.

291.content: Hypostyle Desert Subareas is: Khemenu Temple, Sobek Oasis, The Dune of Carouses, The Dune of Elusion, The Dune of Magma, The Mausoleum of King Deshret.

292.content: is a subarea located in Hypostyle Desert, Great Red Sand, Sumeru

293.content: Adventurers traveling through the Great Red Sand have been known to rest here.

294.content: The Dune of Carouses is home to the Tomb of Carouses, which is described by Soheil as "a miniature version of the Mausoleum of King Deshret.

295.content: is a subarea located in Hypostyle Desert, Great Red Sand, Sumeru

296.content: is a subarea located in Hypostyle Desert, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

297.content: There has been a great cyclone on top of the mausoleum for a long time, though the cause was never determined. It is permanently turned off after completing the World Quest Dual Evidence in Series Old Notes and New Friends.

298.content: is a point of interest located in Hypostyle Desert, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

299.content: It can be accessed through the underground Teleport Waypoint directly south of The Mausoleum of King Deshret. It is connected to the Great Hall of Truths.

300.content: It is connected to Duat Hall at the south side.

301.content: Land of Lower Setekh Point of interest is: Village Chief's House.

302.content: Land of Lower Setekh Subareas is: Aaru Village, Abdju Pit, Dar al-Shifa, Khaj-Nisut.

303.content: The largest human settlement in the desert, Aaru Village houses the followers and descendants of King Deshret, as well as exiled scholars from the Akademiya.

304.content: Prior to Lost in the Sands, the pit is absent and it is named Abdju Road.

305.content: Named after a prayer for patients, Dar al-Shifa used to be a hospital that specialized in treating patients with Eleazar; however, it has now been abandoned.

306.content:
Prior to The Secret of Al-Ahmar, it is named Eye of the Sands.
The ruins that contain King Deshret's throne room are revealed upon completing the three trials in the World Quest Dreams Beneath the Searing Sand.

307.content: It is where the Village Chief of Aaru Village, Uncle Anpu, lives.

308.content: Land of Upper Setekh point of interest is: Lamb-Devourer Rock, Ruin Golem (Valley of Dahri).

309.content:
Land of Upper Setekh is an area located in Great Red Sand, Sumeru.
It is named as such because this land is in the direction of the sun at noon.

310.content: Land of Upper Setekh subareas is: Valley of Dahri.

311.content: Valley of Dahri is a subarea located in Land of Upper Setekh, Great Red Sand, Sumeru.

312.content: It is the Eremites Thutmose's secret base and is accessed during the Old Notes and New Friends World Quest, Hidden Mercenaries.

313.content:
Ruin Golem (Valley of Dahri)	
It is one of three Ruin Golems located in the Sumeru region, alongside the Ruin Golems at Devantaka Mountain and Desert of Hadramaveth.
This Ruin Golem is still operative and will shoot projectiles at the player, dealing AoE Physical DMG and causing massive knockback. Its projectiles can also destroy loose rocks. After a certain point in the Afratu's Dilemma World Quest, the Ruin Golem will cease firing upon the player and the player will be able to operate the Ruin Golem themselves.
